bboxes.raw_text:
The purpose Of Corporation
shall be to work for Charity. The
Corporation shall have the power
TO solicit funds and enter toCon-
tracts for the solicitation Of funds
to be raised for the purpose Of
financing our charitable project
Of power for the maintenance OF
same. 1t shall have the power
to borrow money and to accept
gifts and requests, and own
establish and administer trusts
for the purpose Of the Corpora
ton and in accord with the laws
within the State Of Arizona. The
foregoing enumerated power and
Corporation shall in addition
there to, have power to do all
things necessary, convenient,
incidental or advisable In con-
nection herewith.
ARTICLE II

Irene Provine and Shirley
Roundtree, of Chicago, are visit
ing their grandparents, MIR. and
Mrs. Worchester White and the
Jim Tituses.


Mr.. and Mrs. Robert Weather.
spoon and their grandson, Ron
son, have returned from a vaca-
ton in Illinois, Michigan and
other points in the midwest.


MIR. and Mrs. R. Smith njoyed
that trip to Hawaii.


Hats off to Mrs. Mary Stokes.
who worked so hard during the

MONROE, Ca. : Four Negroes
we're shot in a racial disturbance
near service station in Negro
neighborhood.


Emmett Sims, president of the
NAACP Youth Council here
identified two of the people shot
as Benny Johns on, % and Troy
Malcolm. None we're injured
seriously.


Cause of the disturbance was
not Immediately known.


Earlier in the evening, Sims
said armed Negroes and whites
faced each other across street.
But the assistant chief of police
said, we're just having little
trouble

4 SHOT


IN GEORGIA

The Texas Club of First In
stitutional Baptist Church, ll4l
E. Jefferson is spoons oring a
special program Sum-, Aug. 80.
E am.


DR.. Kermit Long, of Central
Methodist Church, and the Rev.
l.. K. Williams, of Tanner Chapel
AME Church will be guest speak
ers.


James l.. Davis, deacon and
president of the Texas Club is
program chairman.


The Rev. A. G. Kendrick, pas
tor of First Institutional Baptist
Church. invites everyone to at
tend.

CHURCH


PROGRAM SET

anniversary program Of the Rev.
IL. Dunbar.


Debonairs Social and Art Club
will hold its annual Teen Time
party next month. Watch this
column for details.


Fun Club members will end the
summer with a moonlight cele-
bration this Saturday.


Pastors aid society of New
Home Baptist Church will spon-
sor a program Sum-, Aug. 30. Rev.
Mundy will be the guest speaker.


Thought Of the week : Be We
always kind to others. Smith.

All Around


BY FLORA RUFFIN

Board of US. Civil Service
Examiners at the Veterans Ad-
ministration Hospital, 9TH Street
and Indian School Road, Phoenix,
Arizona has announced that ap-
plications for Food Service
Workers, WAL. $l.46 per hour.
and WA-2, Sl.56 per hour, are
now being accepted. All quail
fled applicants will receive con-
sideration without regard to race.
creed. color. national origin, or
sex. Further information and
procedures for filing may be
secured from the Board of Civil
Service Examiners at the
Hospital. Applications will end
September IA.


First President inaugurated In
Washington DC. = Thomas JEFF
ferson.
JOB OPPORTUNITIES

Jefferson Phoenix, Arizona

E. Adams Phoenix, Arizona

W. Monroe Phoenix, Arizona

Madison Phoenix, Arizona
ARTICLE w


That the time of the Com
mencement of this Corporation
shall be the date these Articles
are filed in the office Of the Ari-
IONA Corporation Commission of
the State Of Arizona. and ter
mination thereof shall be twenty
five (25) years thereafter. with
the privilege Of renewal, as
provided by law.

All Of the following named per-
sons, acting as incorporators
herein, we're duly elected Direc-
tors Of the Debonairs, Social and
Art Club, and are the elected,
qualified and acting Directors Of
said Corporation to wit, on June
"a. 1864, at Masonic Temple,
Fourth Street and Jefferson,
Phoenix, Arizona.
ARTICLE III

Mrs. Robert H. Genevieve)
Harper, 72o 3rd ST., was named
a member of the Frank Mangin
Republican for Corporation Com
mission Endorsers' Committee.
In accepting a position on this
statewide committee, headed by

expulsion, and their rights,
powers and authority shall be
set out in the Bylaws Of the
Corporation, and only the
amended or changed as therein
provided.

My Commission expires Dec.
IS, 1868.

Rose Anderson
Notary Public

ARTICLE OF INCORPORATION


OF
DEBONAIRS SOCIAL AND
ART CLUB


Know all Men BY These Presents:
That we, the undersigned, the
duly elected, qualified and Act
ing Board Of Directors Of the
Debonairs Social and Art Club,
do hereby associate ourselves for
the purpose Of forming a nom
profit Club, and to that end do
adopt the following Articles Of
Incorporation:


ARTTCLEI


The name Of the Corporation
will be Debonairs Social and
Art Club, and the principal place
Of business will be In Phoenix,
Arizona.

Attorney G. R. Carlock OF Phoe-
nix, Mrs. Harper, long prominent
in southside COP activities
stated: ''I feel that active sup
port of Frank Mangin is In the.
best interests of good govern
ment."
Mrs. Harper Endorses Mungin

The affairs Of this Corporation
shall be conducted by the Board
of Directors which shall not con-
sist Of less than five (5) or more
tan seven ~. The Board Of
Directors shall be elected at the
Annual Meeting Of the Debonairs
Social and Art Club. Such annual
meeting shall be held on the End
Sunday in January Of each year.
The members Of the Board Of
Directors shall classify them
selves by lot as to their respec-
tive terms Of office. Therefore,
at each annual meeting Of the
Debonairs Social and Art Club
be elected for the term expired.


Vacancies in the Board Of Dr.
rectors and Advisory Board oc-
curing before the expiration Of
any regular term Of office may
be filled and the successor to
such office appointed by the Club
TO serve until the next annual
meeting Of the Debonairs Social
and Art Club.
ARTICLE w
ARTICLE V

has immediate openings for


CREW CHIEF
qualified on the Mach = 2


FlO4
or recent expe rience
on century series aircraft
Requirements are:
l.. Engine run certification
2. Ground support equipment


certification
8. Familiar with procedures


of AIM COL
ARMAMENT MECHANIC
with recent experience
loading guns and installing
rockets, mis- stiles, and bombs
on aircraft
LOCKHEED AIRCRAFT
SER VICE COMPANY
Luke ALB


Open Mon-Sat 8-4:45 pm.
An equal opportunity employer

LOCKHEED AIRCRAFT


SER VICE COMPANY

The Debonairs may organize
as provided by laws. The
qualifications of members and
officers and the conditions Of
their election, suspension and
ARTICLE vi

expulsion, and their rights,
powers and authority shall be
set out in the Bylaws Of the
Corporation, and only the
amended or changed as therein
provided.
ARTICLE VII


All Of the following named
persons, acting as advisory
Board and does not consist Of
any members connected with the
Club we're duly elected as
Advisory Members Of the
Debonairs Social and Art Club,
and are duly elected. qualified
and acting Advisors Of the said
Corporation.


Mr.. Jim Titus


Mrs. Clarence Jackson
Mr.. George Barnes


Mr.. Virgil ]. Berry


Mrs. Clarence R. Laing
Mr.. John Weber


Mr.. Ernest G. Burton
Mr.. Ted Cianas


Statutory Agent:


Mr.. ]. D. Holmes, 1889 East
Monroe, Phoenix, Arizona, who
has been a residence Of the
State Of Arizona for 8 years
Is appointed Statutory Agent.
ARTICLES VIII


The private and individual pro-
pery Of the Members and Of
hcers Of this Corporation shall
not be liable for and be forever
exempt from all debts and labili-
ties Of the Corporation.


Officers Of Incorporation:


Amanda Gray


Adella Calbreath


Alvin Vera Richie


Flora L. Ruffin


Essie Mae Pullins


Lille E. Belcher
Subscribed and sworn to before
me, Rose Anderson, q Notary
Public In. and for the County Of
Maricopa, State Of Arizona, this,
the 9th day Of July 1864.


Rose Anderson


Notary Public
My Commission expires Dec.
IS, 1868.

MIR. J. D. Holmes, l4S9 East


Monroe, Phoenix, Arizona, who
has been a residence Of the
State Of Arizona for 8 years
Is appointed Statutory Agent.
Statutory Agent:
